Subject: Oops?
Message-ID: <3B3AFA09.16275.4F212FF@localhost>
Priority: normal
X-mailer: Pegasus Mail for Win32 (v3.12c)
From: "rAuq" <rauq@...>

--- Bob ---

As Bob enters the Astroid belt, his space craft uncerimoniously becomes a 
relatively large ping pong ball. It bounces off one astroid, only to collide with 
another, and another, and another and son on. This time, however, Bob was 
ready, he'd buckled himself in, and tied himself down to avoid unwated 
injury. He rubs his bruised nose. "Whoooooo..." He sighs as he bounces off 
yet another asteroid. As he comes out of the Asteroid belt, he sees a 
reddish planet off in the distace. He frowns, and looks at his schedual 
sheet. The electro-sheet has a timetable of when Bob must be a a specific 
planet to perform. He checks the red planet's coordinates in comparison 
with target planet. His eyes bulge as he reads his electro-sheet's 
calculations. he was approximately 250 000 000 000 000 AU from the 
target planet. That would take him... he checks his sheet calcuations 
again, 15 years to get back. Bob sits back in his chair. and says one thing: 
"Oops..."

OOC: an "AU" is an Astronomical Unit. It is the mean distance from our 
sun to earth. 92 960 000 miles, or 149 604 970 kilometres. Bob is lost. 
Very lost.
